Literature Review: Biomedical data inequality has become a pressing concern in the field of artificial intelligence, as the existing data sets do not accurately represent the diversity of the human population. This disparity can lead to biased machine learning models that perpetuate health inequities. In this review, we discuss the current status of biomedical data inequality, its impacts on machine learning, and recent advances in algorithmic interventions for mitigating health disparities. We also explore the newly identified disparity in data quality among ethnic groups and its potential impacts on machine learning.
